pageTitle: Inventory of Bounty applications from Silk Commission, 1896-1904.
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {1975=Dates: 1896-1904., 264=This series was archivally processed by Arlene Schmuland in December 1998.}
textBeforeTable: Container List Silk industry—Utah. Sericulture—Utah. Indexing Terms This series was archivally processed by Arlene Schmuland in December 1998. Processing Note Cite the Utah State Archives and Records Service, the creating agency name, the series title, and the series number. Preferred Citation This series is classified as Public. Access Restrictions Financial records from the Silk Commission, Series 20946, contains yearly totals for bounties paid state-wide. Biennial reports from the Silk Commission, Series 5880, contains yearly totals for bounties paid state-wide. Related Records Alphabetical by county, thereunder chronological by year. Arrangement These records document one of the primary activities of the Silk Commission which was to pay bounties to individuals or corporations producing silk cocoons. The bounty applications consist of two documents, the application for bounty signed by the grower and by a representative of the Silk Commission, and a certificate of transmittal to the Secretary of State. Bounties were paid at a rate of 25 cents per pound of cocoons produced. Scope and Content An agency history is available. Historical Note These records are housed in the Utah State Archives' permanent storage room. 0.35 cubic foot Dates: 1896-1904. Silk Commission Bounty applications
